column4: I guess that is system > preferences > compizconfig settings manager?
yes that was it :/ i dont know on the website they called it that, thanks anyway :D
find out what repository supplies it, add that to software sources and install; or compile from source
the very latest, and no i wont try to compile from source, cause last time i tried doing that and installing the libraries my computer crashed and i had to format !
if you're not running karmic I wouldn't use that
it expects karmic stuff, so lots of dependency issues probably
and i cant download the latest from source and mine crashes more often, now what are my choices ?
use other mailclient ;) or use older version that worked for you and lock the version in synaptic
do you have any other mail client as good as evolution ? i don't think Ubuntu chose it for fun, i think they chose it for a purpose !
feel free to give me a client and i'll try it ! maybe i would like it more !
depends on what you want, Thunderbird has lots of features, claws-mail is very lightweight and is just an emailclient
IMAP, POP3, SMTP, and Address book !
I think you can convert evolution address book to clawsmail, google that
